Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First I need to understand the two parts the normative rules strict and the desiderata recommended but not strict The task is to check the event log for violations of these rules and explain why each case is violating or not

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Starting with Part 1 Normative Process Behavior Strict Rules The key here is the sequence and order of activities The process must follow exactly the steps in order without skipping or reordering and specific actions must or must not happen based on the loan decision

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1 The activities are in order Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Approved Inform Applicant Finalize Documentation Close Case This follows all the steps correctly After approval they finalize the documentation before closing The order is correct So this case is compliant with the normative rules No violations here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 The first activity after receiving the application is Risk Assessment But according to the rules Credit Check must come before Risk Assessment Here they skipped the Credit Check step entirely since the next step after Application is Risk Assessment Thats a clear violation of the sequence

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Wait let me check again The steps for Case 2 Application Received on 2024 01 11 0800 Next is Risk Assessment at 0820 But Credit Check hasnt happened yet So thats a violation because Credit Check must come before Risk Assessment Then they do Credit Check at 0900 but thats after Risk Assessment So the order is wrong here The Credit Check should have been done before Risk Assessment but they did Risk Assessment first then Credit Check Thats a violation of the ordering rules Also after the Loan Decision Rejected they do Finalize Documentation which is not allowed So thats another violation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So Case 2 has two violations 1 Credit Check not done before Risk Assessment they did Risk Assessment before Credit Check violating the order 2 Finalizing documentation after a rejected loan

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 Lets look at the steps here The first Credit Check is on 2024 01 14 two days after the application The problem here is that the Credit Check is supposed to be done within a short time like 24 hours but this is a desideratum violation not a strict rule

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking at the sequence After Application they do Credit Check later but thats allowed as per strict rules just the timing is a desideratum issue The Credit Check is done eventually before Risk Assessment on 14th then Risk Assessment same day So the order Credit Check Risk Assessment is correct Then Loan Decision then Inform Applicant The problem here is that the Inform Applicant is supposed to happen after Loan Decision which it does However the timing between Loan Decision 12th and Inform Applicant 16th is more than 48 hours they are 4 days apart Thats a desideratum violation recommended but not strict Also the Finalize Documentation is done after Inform Applicant but according to the rules after Loan Decision you inform the applicant then if approved finalize documentation before closing Here they inform the applicant first then finalize documentation The order here is correct Loan Decision Inform Finalize Close The problem is just the timing of the inform being too late Also theres no follow up call mentioned which is another desideratum violation they just have No Follow up Call

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So for Case 3s violations Desideratum violations 1 Credit Check took more than 24 hours after application 2 Inform Applicant was informed more than 48 hours after the Loan Decision 3 No follow up call These are all desiderata issues not strict rule violations

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 1 Identify which cases violate the normative rules Case 2 is the only one violating the strict rules Because Missing Credit Check before Risk Assessment they did Risk Assessment first without Credit Check Finalizing documentation after a rejected loan Case 1 is okay Case 3s issues are all desiderata non strict

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Wait but in Case 2 after the Risk Assessment they did the Loan Decision The order from Credit Check to Risk Assessment to Loan Decision is correct once the Credit Check is done Wait in Case 2 the Credit Check is done after the Risk Assessment Let me re examine Case 2s timeline 0800 Application Received 0820 Risk Assessment without prior Credit Check 0900 Credit Check after Risk Assessment 0930 Loan Decision Rejected So the Credit Check is done after Risk Assessment which violates the rule that Credit Check must come before Risk Assessment Therefore the sequence is wrong here The Credit Check must be done before Risk Assessment So the Risk Assessment cannot happen until after Credit Check Since in Case 2 Risk Assessment happened before Credit Check thats a violation of the ordering rules Additionally after Loan Decision Rejected they do Finalize Documentation which is not allowed So two violations here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So for Part 1 only Case 2 violates the normative rules

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 2 Identify which cases fail to meet the desiderata conditions These are the cases where the timing recommendations are not met Looking at the event log Case 2s Credit Check timing of how long after the application is not mentioned as a problem The problem in Case 2s Credit Check is the order not the timing the timing of Credit Check within 24 hours is okay So the desiderata violations in Case 2 would be none except maybe the follow up call Since theres no mention of a follow up call in Case 2 So Case 2 might not have a follow up call either but thats a desideratum violation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking at Case 3 Credit Check was done on the 14th which is two days after the application received on the 12th The desideratum says within 24 hours so two days is a violation The Inform Applicant was done on the 16th which is 4 days after the Loan Decision 12th The recommendation was within 48 hours so thats a violation No follow up call mentioned so another desideratum violation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1 All steps are on the same day so timing wise they followed the recommendations For example Credit Check within a few hours Inform within a few hours after decision So no desideratum violations here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So for desiderata violations non strict Case 2 Skipped follow up call no entry so assumed not done Case 3 Credit Check after 24 hours desired within 24h Inform Applicant after 48 hours desired within 48h No follow up call

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: For Case 2s Credit Check after Risk Assessment The only way this could be justified is if there was an emergency or an exception but according to the strict rules its not allowed Since the problem states that the normative rules must be followed this is a violation and cant be justified

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3s Credit Check being late Maybe the applicant was unavailable but the process should still do the Credit Check as soon as possible The desideratum is a recommendation so its a best practice but not a rule So its a deviation but not a violation

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3s delayed Inform Applicant Perhaps the applicant was out of contact but ideally they should be informed promptly The delay is a desideratum violation but allowed

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2s Finalize after rejection This is a strict rule violation so cannot be justified

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3s no follow up call Its a desideratum violation but allowed

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So possible justifications for the desiderata violations non strict For Case 3s Credit Check timing The credit check was delayed due to system downtime or higher priority cases However ideally it should have been done within 24 hours For the delayed inform in Case 3 The applicant was unavailable initially and only responded after some time The process should have proactively contacted the applicant earlier For Case 2s skipped follow up call The team might have been busy and overlooked the follow up but its a best practice to include it

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: Now putting this all together
